title: Pierre, South Dakota
summary: Pierre (/pɪər/ PEER; Lakota: čhúŋkaške, lit. 'fort'[5]) is the capital city of South Dakota and the seat of Hughes County.[6] The population was 14,091 at the 2020 census, making it the second-least populous state capital in the United States, following Montpelier, Vermont. It is the eighth-most populous city in South Dakota. Founded in 1880, it was selected as the state capital when the territory was admitted as a state. Pierre is the principal city of the Pierre Micropolitan Statistical Area, which includes all of Hughes and Stanley counties.
